home.title:
REAL-TIME
WORLD POPULATION DATA
home.subtitle: Interactive Dashboards
home.description: Explore global population with real-time updates. Analyze births, deaths and migration trends through interactive charts.

livePopulation.title: LIVE POPULATION FLOW
livePopulation.description: Track global population dynamics with real-time data updated minutes ago.

opensource.title: FREE AND OPEN SOURCE DECLARATION
opensource.description: We track world population data in real-time using open-source technologies.
technologies: Worldometer provides real-time and reliable world population data continuously.
Elasticsearch ensures exceptional performance for data querying and analysis.
Kibana is rigorously used for dynamic visualization of population data.
Docker successfully handles deployment and isolation with environment independence.
This website is developed with Vue.js modern JavaScript framework.
Python's powerful libraries efficiently support data processing.

faq.title: WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW ABOUT THE PROJECT
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most frequently asked questions about population data and the project here.

questions.technologies: What technologies does the project use?
questions.updateFrequency: What is the data update frequency?

answers.technologies: Project uses Vue.js 3 Composition API. Python Selenium for web scraping, Elasticsearch for data storage. AWS handles data flow and server needs. Tailwind CSS manages styling.
answers.security: Data transferred via secure connection to Elasticsearch, protected by AWS security measures.
answers.contribute: Our project is open source. Open issues or send pull requests via GitHub.
answers.updateFrequency: Data refreshes every 5-15 minutes via Python code running on AWS.
answers.dashboards: Kibana creates dynamic visualizations from Elasticsearch data. Users can filter across panels.

about.title: ABOUT & RESOURCES
about.description: This project uses Worldometer's population data for global/country analysis. Contact us to contribute to our open-source project!
